elements.name: city
elements.description: City portion of the mailing address

elements.name: stateCode
elements.description:
For U.S. addresses, the U.S. Postal Service state code abbreviation.
For Canadian addresses, the Canadian province/territory code.
For Mexican addresses, the Mexican state code.Otherwise, the code is FN for foreign.

elements.name: postalCode
elements.description: If the address is a U.S. address, the first 5 positions of the ZIP code are numeric. The last 4 positions of the U.S. ZIP code are optional; and if they are included, they are also numeric.For a Canadian address, the Canadian Postal Codewill be an in ANANAN format.For a Mexican address, the Postal Code will be 5 numeric characters.All other foreign addresses may use up to 9 characters or may be space filled.
